    • Field Detail

      • started

        protected transient volatile boolean started

      • starting

        protected transient volatile boolean starting

      • destroyed

        protected transient volatile boolean destroyed

      • log

        protected final org.slf4j.Logger log

      • requestLog

        protected final org.slf4j.Logger requestLog

      • apis

        protected java.util.List<Api> apis

      • resourceLoader

        protected Engine.ResourceLoader resourceLoader

      • configurator

        protected Configurator configurator

      • profile

        protected java.lang.String profile
        The runtime profile that will be used to load inversion[1-99]-$profile.properties files. This is used so that you can ship common settings in inversion[1-99].properties files that are loaded for all profiles and put custom settings in dev/stage/prod (for example) profile specific settings files.

      • configPath

        protected java.lang.String configPath
        The path to inversion*.properties files

      • configTimeout

        protected int configTimeout
        The number of milliseconds between background reloads of the Api config

      • configFast

        protected boolean configFast
        Indicates that the supplied config files contain all the setup info and the Api will not be reflectively configured as it otherwise would.

      • configDebug

        protected boolean configDebug

      • configOut

        protected java.lang.String configOut

      • lastResponse

        protected transient volatile Response lastResponse
        The last response returned. Not that useful in concurrent production environments but useful for writing test cases.

      • listeners

        protected transient java.util.List<Engine.EngineListener> listeners

      • allowedHeaders

        protected java.lang.String allowedHeaders
        Engine reflects all request headers along with those supplied in allowHeaders as "Access-Control-Allow-Headers" response headers. This is primarily a CROS security thing and you probably won't need to customize this list.
